summary: This document is a JPMorgan Chase Bank response to an FBI subpoena (Case No. 2019R01059) for financial records related to Tova Noel and Michael Thomas. It includes an affidavit from a bank custodian and account records, primarily for Tova A. Noel, such as signature cards and a Land Rover lease statement. This document appears to be a series of Land Rover Financial Group auto lease statements and payment coupons, likely related to vehicle lease payments. The content is primarily financial transaction records with payment instructions and terms. This document is a series of Land Rover Financial Group account statements and payment coupons for a leased vehicle, showing billing details, payment instructions, and account activity. It appears to be financial documentation related to vehicle leasing, with no direct mention of Epstein case individuals or events. This document consists of Land Rover Financial Group account statements and payment coupons for a vehicle lease. It shows billing information, payment due dates, and standard account terms. The document appears to be routine financial correspondence related to a vehicle lease account. This document is a collection of bank statements, lease agreements, and financial transaction records for an account holder named Tova A. Noel (also referenced as Tova Noel-Christian). It includes Chase Premier Plus checking account statements from December 2018 through November 2019, a Land Rover Financial Group lease application and payment records, and various deposit/withdrawal details. The records show regular deposits, payments for a Land Rover lease, and transactions in New York, particularly the Bronx.

connections.description: Both are named as subjects in the same FBI case (2019R01059) for which JPMorgan Chase produced financial records.
Esqueda, as a JPMorgan Chase custodian of records, certified the bank records for Tova Noel's accounts in response to the subpoena.
Lucas, as a Chase operations manager, oversaw the delivery of Noel's financial records to the FBI.

events.title: JPMorgan Chase responds to FBI subpoena
events.description: JPMorgan Chase's National Subpoena Processing department sends financial records to the FBI at 26 Federal Plaza, New York, in response to a subpoena for case 2019R01059 involving Tova Noel and Michael Thomas.

events.title: Land Rover lease welcome
events.description: Land Rover Financial Group (serviced by Chase) sends a welcome letter to Tova A. Noel regarding her new Land Rover Range Rover lease.

events.title: Reference Case Initiation
events.description: Multiple transaction records are tagged with 'Reference Case Number: G16Dec19-1981', indicating these documents were likely compiled or requested in relation to a case investigation on December 16, 2019.

events.title: Chase Disclosure Update
events.description: Chase updated its Deposit Account Agreement and Additional Banking Services and Fees document, clarifying fees for incoming wires.

events.title: Chase Replacement Account Policy
events.description: Chase announced a new policy making it easier to get a replacement account number if an account is compromised, without closing the existing account.

locations: Glen Cove, NY (Land Rover Glen Cove dealer)
keyFacts: The FBI subpoenaed JPMorgan Chase for financial records related to Tova Noel and Michael Thomas under Case No. 2019R01059.
Tova A. Noel held multiple Chase checking accounts and had an auto lease for a Land Rover Range Rover through Chase's Land Rover Financial Group.
The document includes certified bank records (signature cards, statements) provided under affidavit by JPMorgan Chase custodian Evelyn A Esqueda.
The records production was managed by JPMorgan Chase's National Subpoena Processing department in Indianapolis.
Document contains Land Rover Financial Group auto lease statements and payment information.
Multiple account holders are listed including Ted Salta, Tom A Ngel, and Toya A Wel.
The documents show routine financial transactions for vehicle lease payments.
Payment instructions include options for online, mobile, branch, and mail payments.
Standard lease agreement terms and conditions are described throughout the documents.
Document consists of Land Rover Financial Group account statements and payment coupons.
Statements show billing dates, payment due dates, and account status messages.
No named individuals related to the Epstein case are mentioned in this text.
The text is primarily standard financial/leasing terms and conditions.
Document appears to be routine vehicle lease documentation without evident connection to the case.
The document is a Land Rover Financial Group account statement and payment coupon for a vehicle lease.
Statement dates are October 10, 2019 and November 12, 2019, with corresponding payment due dates.
The account shows a zero balance and no payment currently due as of the statement dates.
The leased vehicle is a Land Rover Range Rover.
The document contains standard financial terms, payment instructions, and contact information for customer service.
The primary account holder is Tova A. Noel (also Tova Noel-Christian), with a Chase Premier Plus checking account benefiting from Chase Military Banking fee waivers.
A Land Rover Range Rover Velar lease was applied for and paid from this account, with regular payments of $811.49.
Financial records show numerous deposits via Zelle, ATM cash deposits, and checks from entities like OTC Medical Services, Inc., Logistics Health, Inc., and USAA.
Transaction activity is concentrated in the Bronx, NY area, with frequent ATM withdrawals and purchases at local businesses.
The documents are stamped with 'Reference Case Number: G16Dec19-1981', indicating they were gathered as part of an investigative case file.
